VER Rental AgentPOSITION DESCRIPTION:--Responsible for the successful management of key accounts along with supporting a growing new customer database. The position requires strong production and event knowledge, excellent communication skills, and the ability to liaise closely with clients and internal technical support personnel. In addition to working with VER’s proprietary software system (REV), the position also requires internal management of logistics including inter-office equipment transfers, freight tracking, equipment knowledge, and servicing customer expectations.--●  Coordinated production equipment rentals for live broadcasts, corporate a/v events, film productions, etc., for a wide variety of professional clients, such as NBC’s The Voice, Seattle Seahawks, World Of Dance, Arizona Cardinals, Seattle Storm WNBA, Sundance Film Festival, Seattle Westin, Blue Danube Productions, Screaming Flea Productions, Run Studios, The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, Satis&fy, Reaction, Mighty Media Studios, The Boeing Company, PAX Seattle, Amazon, AEG, AVMS, PRG, PSAV, etc.●  Promoted sales, fostered company reputation, and developed new industry company accounts for clients such as T-Mobile, Evergreen State College, Union Gospel Mission, Overlook Film Festival, ZDF Medienproduktion, Radical Media, Carlson Audio, Atlantis Events Inc., PNTA, Montana Pro Audio, Life Center Church, Lion Television, King County Department Of Natural Resources and Parks, Blanket Fort Films, etc.●  Developed in-house company workbook and digital sales tracking sheets in Excel for internal company use.

● Coordinated, crewed, and oversaw stadium events, such as the NFL Draft Party 2015, Phoenix Comicon Fan Fest 2015, Big Red Rib & Music Festival 2015, etc.● Provided video engineering, equipment maintenance, and production technician services to stadium events, such as the NFC Divisional Championship 2016, College Football National Championship 2016, Fiesta Bowl 2016, etc.● Performed clerical office financial data entry and event bookkeeping for stadium events, wrote and designed the Cardinals A/V Employee Handbook, and conducted new-hire orientations and training sessions.● Lead Replay Producer for the Arizona Cardinals 2015 football season, and Fox Sports CARDS OT Post-Game Show.● Lead Field Utility Manager for Super Bowl XLIX and Pro Bowl 2015.
Freelance Film/Video Production and Post-Production Services

● Completed freelance production and post-production film and video services as a Director, Assistant Director, Video Editor, Production Coordinator, Unit Production Manager, Production/Post-Production Consultant, etc.● Director/Producer of KHANE BLACK – Feature Film (2012).● Director/Producer of YOLO – Short Film (*Best Picture, *Best Director, GCU Film Festival, 2013).● Director/Producer of One Good Deed – Short Film (*2nd Best Picture, Arizona State Film Festival, 2013).● Video Editor/Producer of NHRMA: 75 Years – Corporate Video (2013).● Video Editor/Producer of VetsOnMedia: The Battle Against PTSD – Documentary (2014).

● Performed in-house national broadcast services for a wide variety of professional clients, such as Fox News, CNBC, Fox Business News, ABC, CBL, etc.● Co-Producer for Wake Up America’s National Broadcast and Web-A-Thon.● Co-Producer for Dr. Benjamin Carson’s Westin-Kierland Gala Presentation.● Production Technician for ABC’s Shark Tank: Titin Guest Segment.● First Assistant Camera for CNBC’s Dollar Days: Broadcast Special Segment.● Camera Op/Production Technician for Fox Business News: Money & After The Bell Segments.

● Designed educational lectures & training seminars for Grand Canyon University faculty.● Produced campus equipment & software tutorial videos.● A/V & IT technical assistance for faculty development department and course professors.● Taught lectures in Microsoft Office, SMART Board, iRespond, Adobe Creative Suite, Final CutPro, etc.

summary: Christopher Cline was born and raised in Tacoma Washington and has been actively involved in both film and live television production since his early childhood. He has worked on over 300 film, television, and live event projects over the years, serving a wide variety of professional roles. His ideal positions include working as a Director, Producer, Production Coordinator, Executive Assistant, etc. He currently lives in Seattle Washington, where he performs freelance production and post-production services.In 2016, Cline graduated Valedictorian from Full Sail University, with an MS in Entertainment Business. He also received Full Sail ’s Advanced Achievement Award, as well as three Course Director Awards for excellence in Project and Team Management, Business Plan Development, and his Final Project: Business Plan. He is a former Summa Cum Laude graduate of Grand Canyon University (2014), where he received his BA in Digital Film Production. He is also a graduate of Disney Institute’s Supervisor Customer Service and Leadership Planning Training program, and continues to take educational courses through Lynda.com, Khan Academy, Hillsdale College, and Prager University. He is a registered member of the Republican Party, Conservative Party, Constitution Party, and Libertarian Party.Cline is also a former Production Coordinator, Engineering Technician, and Replay Producer for the Arizona Cardinals. Some highlights of this career included serving as the Lead Field Utility Manager for Super Bowl XLIX, as well as the Lead Replay Producer for the Arizona Cardinals 2015 football season. Additional clients that Cline has provided production services for have included: The Walt Disney Company, Seattle Seahawks, Microsoft, NBC's The Voice, NBC's World Of Dance, CNBC, Fox Business News, Travel Channel, WWE, Phoenix Comicon, Lady Gaga, Paul McCartney, Blake Shelton, Katy Perry, Linkin Park, KC & The Sunshine Band, Fleetwood Mac, Dr. Benjamin Carson, etc.
